Java class for IndexBufferType complex type.

The following schema fragment specifies the expected content contained within this class. 

 <complexType name="IndexBufferType">
   <complexContent>
     <extension base="{}Object3DType">
       <sequence>
         <element name="indices">
           <simpleType>
             <restriction base="{}uintList">
               <minLength value="1"/>
             </restriction>
           </simpleType>
         </element>
       </sequence>
     </extension>
   </complexContent>
 </complexType>

Constructor Detail

IndexBufferType

Method Detail

getIndices

public java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger> getIndices()
Gets the value of the indices property.

This accessor method returns a reference to the live list, not a snapshot. Therefore any modification you make to the returned list will be present inside the JAXB object. This is why there is not a set method for the indices property.

For example, to add a new item, do as follows: 

    getIndices().add(newItem);

Objects of the following type(s) are allowed in the list BigInteger
